Posts.EditableText: It's a Quest 4 game There are two things wrong here: - first, you're unlocking the wrong exit. Your locked exit is "go east", not "go to Room B", so your "unlock" script command needs to unlock Room A's "east" exit. - secondly, the object remains in the inventory because you haven't told Quest to do anything else with it. Use the "take an object from the player" command in your "give" script to remove the ticket from the inventory.
Posts.HTML:
It's a Quest 4 game

There are two things wrong here:

- first, you're unlocking the wrong exit. Your locked exit is "go east", not "go to Room B", so your "unlock" script command needs to unlock Room A's "east" exit.
- secondly, the object remains in the inventory because you haven't told Quest to do anything else with it. Use the "take an object from the player" command in your "give" script to remove the ticket from the inventory.

Posts.EditableText: If you create a room called "inventory", you can put anything in there that you want the player to be holding at the start of the game. So you can add a "wallet" object, and add your "bill" objects, with their parent set to "wallet".
